FINDDISAPPEARED(1) General Commands Manual FINDDISAPPEARED(1)

NAME

finddisappeared — find files that are owned by package manager but disappeared

SYNOPSIS

finddisappeared [-hv] [-r rootdir]

DESCRIPTION

The finddisappeared utility lists the files that are owned by package manager (listed in the package database), but missing (somehow disappeared) on the actual file system.

The options are as follows:

-r rootdir, --root=rootdir
Specify an alternate root directory instead of the default ‘/’.
-v, --version
Print version and exit.
-h, --help
Print help and exit.

SEE ALSO

finddepsdistmeta(1), finddepslinked(1), finddisowned(1), findredundantdeps(1)
